snippet: There should be a law to punish bystanders who do nothing to help in an emergency.
abstract: Op-Ed article by law Prof Jay Sterling Silver cites case of Staten Island woman Glenda Moore, whose pleas for assistance went ignored when her two young sons were swept away by water during Hurricane Sandy, calls for legislation that would punish bystanders who do nothing to help during emergency.
lead_paragraph: There should be a law to punish bystanders who do nothing to help in an emergency.

headline.seo: Can the Law Make ‘Bad Samaritans’ Be Decent?
headline.main: Can the Law Make Us Be Decent?
headline.print_headline: Can the Law Make Us Be Decent?
